title: Honor X60 GT design officially unveiled, launch date too
description: The Honor X60 GT is now up for pre-reservation on Honor's online store in China, and it's due to be launched on April 22. It's part of a trio of "GT" labeled devices that Honor is coming out with next week, the other two being the Honor GT Pro smartphone and the Honor Pad GT. The Honor X60 GT will complement the already available Honor X60 in the company's portfolio, and it will be offered in the two colorways you can see below. It is likely to sport a battery with a rated capacity of 6,120 mAh, which will probably translate into an advertised typical capacity of 6,300 mAh or...
excerpt: It's part of a trio of GT devices coming next week. The Honor X60 GT is now up for pre-reservation on Honor's online store in China, and it's due to be...
text: The Honor X60 GT is now up for pre-reservation on Honor's online store in China, and it's due to be launched on April 22. It's part of a trio of "GT" labeled devices that Honor is coming out with next week, the other two being the Honor GT Pro smartphone and the Honor Pad GT. The Honor X60 GT will complement the already available Honor X60 in the company's portfolio, and it will be offered in the two colorways you can see below. It is likely to sport a battery with a rated capacity of 6,120 mAh, which will probably translate into an advertised typical capacity of 6,300 mAh or thereabouts. It will support 90W fast wired charging. Rumor has it the Honor X60 GT will be powered by the Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 SoC (yes, really), paired with 12GB of RAM and 256GB of storage. Source (in Chinese) | Via
html:
The Honor X60 GT is now up for pre-reservation on Honor's online store in China, and it's due to be launched on April 22. It's part of a trio of "GT" labeled devices that Honor is coming out with next week, the other two being the Honor GT Pro smartphone and the Honor Pad GT.

The Honor X60 GT will complement the already available Honor X60 in the company's portfolio, and it will be offered in the two colorways you can see below.

It is likely to sport a battery with a rated capacity of 6,120 mAh, which will probably translate into an advertised typical capacity of 6,300 mAh or thereabouts. It will support 90W fast wired charging.

Rumor has it the Honor X60 GT will be powered by the Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 SoC (yes, really), paired with 12GB of RAM and 256GB of storage.

Source (in Chinese) | Via
